titleStmt.title: A royall protestation made by the Kings Most Excellent Majestie, to the dukes, marquesses, earles, barons, gentlemen, now assembled at Beverley in Yorkshire. Iuly 22. 1642. And prescribed to be taken by all his Majesties followers. The said protestation tending to the preservation of the Protestant religion, and the lawes of the kingdome. Published by his Majesties speciall command. Whereunto is annexed likewise the Parliaments protestation to maintaine the said religion, the lawes of the kingdome, and the liberty of the subjects. Ordered by the Lords and Commons that this bee printed and published. Jo. Browne, Cler. Parl.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)

Published by his Majesties speciall command. Whereunto is annexed likewise the Parliaments protestation to maintaine the said religion, the lawes of the kingdome, and the liberty of the subjects.
